subject: QS news update Nov 16
msgSnippet: Hi group, I ve been busy changing the way the news will appear and wanted to make everyone aware of the changes. 1. Common abbreviations, as prescribed by
messageBody:
Hi group,

I've been busy changing the way the news will appear and wanted to make
everyone aware of the changes.

1. Common abbreviations, as prescribed by Read, should appear in the
articles. For QS newcomers such as myself, these abbreviations will take
some getting used to, but I think in the long run they will help everyone.

2. The more common form of words should replace the less common ones.
Previously, I had taken the last entry in my dictionary to translate
words into QS. I was informed that the first ones were the ones more
commonly used. So instead of "Mman" for human, you should see "hMan."
Likewise, those missing Ts in words should come back.

Let me know if there are problems with either change.

Paul

Hi group,

I've been busy changing the way the news will appear and wanted to make 
everyone aware of the changes.

1. Common abbreviations, as prescribed by Read, should appear in the 
articles. For QS newcomers such as myself, these abbreviations will take 
some getting used to, but I think in the long run they will help everyone.

2. The more common form of words should replace the less common ones. 
Previously, I had taken the last entry in my dictionary to translate 
words into QS. I was informed that the first ones were the ones more 
commonly used. So instead of "Mman" for human, you should see "hMan." 
Likewise, those missing Ts in words should come back.

Let me know if there are problems with either change.

Paul
